::: {.question} **Deleveraging and Share Issuance** Company Y has 50 million shares outstanding and a market capitalization of 2 billion. It also has 756 million in debt outstanding. The company plans to **delever completely** by issuing new equity and repaying all outstanding debt. Assume perfect capital markets. How many new shares must the company issue (in million)? ::: {.question-block}
✅ New shares = Debt ÷ Price = 756 ÷ 40 = 18.9 million.
::: :::
